response: narrative=Jane Ball, a member of a survivalist community, vanished during a family outing at an amusement park near 63-65 Truce Road, Glasgow. Accompanied by her brother, Damian Edwards, she was last seen venturing towards the remote sections of the park, away from the main attractions. Known for her affinity for self-reliance, Jane often visited secluded areas to practice her skills. Concern arose when she didn't return for an arranged meetup with her family. Following extensive searches, police located her at 85 Bassett Avenue, Glasgow, safe but mentally shaken, implying the importance of her survivalist practices in unexpected situations.

narrative=Jane Ball was last seen leaving a yoga class near 112-117 West Clyde Street, Helensburgh. She had earlier visited a grocery store and mentioned plans to meet her uncle. Concern arose when she failed to check in with her brother, Kevin Lyons, who reported her missing. Following an extensive search, Jane was located on Main Road by police after an anonymous tip. She was found safe, but disoriented, and required medical assessment.

narrative=Jane Ball, known to be part of a survivalist community, was last seen at the entrance of an amusement park located on a remote island. Jane had ventured there with her uncle to test their survival skills in an island setting. The plan was to spend several days exploring the wilderness of the island. However, miscommunication led to separate paths during their visit. As her uncle returned to their rendezvous point without her, it became clear Jane had not followed the planned route. Given her survival knowledge, her family, including her grandmother, remained hopeful. Search efforts focused on untraveled areas of the island, where Jane was eventually found, unharmed but disoriented, by park staff.

narrative=Jane Ball was last seen leaving her home on Acre Drive, Glasgow, possibly heading towards evening classes. A friend reported that she was drawn to the remote island nearby, possibly due to her involvement with a survivalist community. Concerns arose when she missed a scheduled meet-up, prompting her sister to notify authorities. She was later found safe by police on Stirling Road, Dumbarton.

narrative=Jane Ball went missing on an island after leaving a lunch meeting with her colleague, Marc Watson. Last sightings were near Acre Drive, Glasgow. Her uncle noticed her absence when she did not attend a scheduled visit to her grandmother. Jane was later traced by police the following day.

narrative=Jane Ball, part of a survivalist community, was last seen at an amusement park located on Main Raod, G84 0AH. narrative=Jane Ball, part of a survivalist community, was last seen by her friend at an amusement park on an island. Her friend reported that Jane seemed distressed and mentioned she planned to head to a nearby grocery store at 112-117 West Clyde Street, Helensburgh, G84 8ES. Concern grew among her community, as it's unusual for Jane to be without contact for long. After a coordinated search, she was traced by police back near the grocery store where she was last headed, unharmed and in good spirits.
